alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 18 at 7:36PM CST until January 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by the sudden shifting or break up of an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The lower Kankakee River from near Wilmington downstream to the confluence with the Illinois River, including portions of Grundy and Will counties. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Dangerous ice flows or shifting of ice may damage structures along the shore. Additional roads and streets may be flooded. Localized water level fluctuations possible due to an ice jam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A significant ice jam is located on the Kankakee River near the confluence with the Illinois River to just upstream of Wilmington. The ice jam is holding back a significant amount of water. Continued cold weather has likely begun to freeze the ice jam in place, which reduces the risk of downstream flooding over the next few days. Sudden shifting or breaking may still be possible, which could cause new flooding with limited advanced notice. The risk of breaking and shifting of this ice jam may again increase by next week due to warmer temperatures. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
